definition: spread out, cause to become widely known
details:
adjective
- spread out
- lacking conciseness
= example: lacking conciseness
- (of light) transmitted from a broad light source or reflected
= synonyms: soft
verb
- cause to become widely known
= synonyms: spread, broadcast, propagate, circulate, disperse, circularize, circularise, distribute, disseminate, pass around
- spread or diffuse through
= synonyms: riddle, imbue, penetrate, interpenetrate, permeate, pervade
- move outward
= synonyms: spread, spread out, fan out
